articles.author: Dahlia Nehme
articles.title: Equatorial Guinea to add 20,000 bpd of oil production this year
articles.description: Equatorial Guinea will add 20,000 barrels per day (bpd) of oil production by October, the country's oil minister said on Sunday.
articles.content:
ABU DHABI (Reuters) - Equatorial Guinea will add 20,000 barrels per day (bpd) of oil production by October, the country’s oil minister said on Sunday. 
“We expect an increase this year of around 20,000 bpd additional because of the new discoveries,” Gabriel … [+2080 chars]

articles.author: Moussa Aksar
articles.title: Niger army base attack death toll rises to at least 89 -security sources
articles.description: The death toll from Thursday's attack by suspected jihadists on a Niger army base has risen to at least 89, four security sources said, surpassing a raid last month that killed 71 soldiers as the deadliest against Nigerien forces in years.
articles.content: NIAMEY (Reuters) - The death toll from Thursday’s attack by suspected jihadists on a Niger army base has risen to at least 89, four security sources said, surpassing a raid last month that killed 71 soldiers as the deadliest against Nigerien forces in years. … [+1915 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Israeli education minister implies homosexuality unnatural
articles.description: Several Israeli school districts held impromptu tolerance classes on Sunday after the country's education minister, an Orthodox rabbi, angered LGBT campaigners by implying homosexuality was unnatural.
articles.content:
JERUSALEM (Reuters) - Several Israeli school districts held impromptu tolerance classes on Sunday after the country’s education minister, an Orthodox rabbi, angered LGBT campaigners by implying homosexuality was unnatural. 
The furore over the remarks by Edu… [+1607 chars]

articles.title: Bank of England's Woods warns financial sector of crackdown - Telegraph
articles.description: Bank of England Deputy Governor Sam Woods on Sunday said that Britain's financial sector could face a crackdown by regulators seeking to enforce their rules more tightly.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Bank of England Deputy Governor Sam Woods on Sunday said that Britain’s financial sector could face a crackdown by regulators seeking to enforce their rules more tightly.

articles.title: China's Hengfeng Bank aims to list in 5 years: Xinhua
articles.description: China's Hengfeng Bank will aim to list in five years after completing a restructuring, state media Xinhua reported a senior bank official as saying, part of government efforts to support indebted smaller banks.'
articles.content:
BEIJING (Reuters) - China’s Hengfeng Bank will aim to list in five years after completing a restructuring, state media Xinhua reported a senior bank official as saying, part of government efforts to support indebted smaller banks.

articles.title: Political newcomer to become Malta's prime minister
articles.description: Political newcomer Robert Abela was set to become Malta's new prime minister having been elected leader of the ruling Labor Party following a vote on Saturday.
articles.content:
VALLETTA (Reuters) - Political newcomer Robert Abela was set to become Malta’s new prime minister having been elected leader of the ruling Labor Party following a vote on Saturday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: NHL roundup: Lightning shut out Flyers for 10th straight win
articles.description: Pat Maroon scored the only goal to lift the visiting Tampa Bay Lightning past the Philadelphia Flyers 1-0 on Saturday for their 10th straight victory.
articles.content:
Pat Maroon scored the only goal to lift the visiting Tampa Bay Lightning past the Philadelphia Flyers 1-0 on Saturday for their 10th straight victory. 
The 10 straight wins tied a franchise record set last season. The Lightning improved to 19-0-4 this season… [+6303 chars]
